description.p: classifies candidate binary relations with ensemble models finetuned with RE-BERT/
Candidate relations can be either asserted by specifying tuples of a relation, or generated by specifying the set of subject and object arguments, or a combination of both.
assertedCandidates specifies the elements corresponding to asserted candidates. Arguments are specified with assertedSubject and assertedObject.

candidateGenerationScope specifies the scope of generated andidates, e.g. documents or sentences. The list of elements corresponding the arguments are specified with generatedSubjects and generatedObjects. For each scope, will generate a candidate for all combinations of subject and object.

The selection of the model is specified with modelType (bert, biobert, or scibert) and finetunedModel. ensembleNumber is the number of models used to make a prediction, ensembleNumber must be less or equal than the number of finetuned models. The final prediction is aggregated by vote.
stores the prediction in labelFeature either in the asserted candidate, or a new tuple for generated candidates. does not create tuples for negative predictions unless createNegativeTuples.

param-doc.name: aggregator
param-doc.p: Aggregation method of predictions of all ensemble models. Only vote is available.

param-doc.name: assertedCandidates
param-doc.p: Asserted candidates. The expression is evaluatd as a list of elements from the corpus.

param-doc.name: assertedObject
param-doc.p: Object (right) argument of asserted candidates. The expression is evaluated as a single element from the asserted candidate element (see assertedCandidates).

param-doc.name: assertedSubject
param-doc.p: Subject (left) argument of asserted candidates. The expression is evaluated as a single element from the asserted candidate element (see assertedCandidates).

param-doc.name: candidateGenerationScope
param-doc.p: Scopes for the generated candidates. The expression is evaluated as a list of elements from the corpus.

param-doc.name: conda
param-doc.p: Path to a conda executable. If not set, then uses the conda from the environment PATH.

param-doc.name: condaEnvironment
param-doc.p: Name of the conda environment. If this parameter is set, then RE-BERT will be executed under a Conda environment.

param-doc.name: createAssertedTuples
param-doc.p: If set to true, then creates a tuple even for asserted candidates. labelFeature will be set on the created tuple instead of the asserted candidate element.

param-doc.name: createNegativeTuples
param-doc.p: If set to true, then creates a tuple even for generated candidates predicted as negative.

param-doc.name: end
param-doc.p: End position of candidates (asserted and generated). This expression is evaluated as an integer from the candidate element.

param-doc.name: ensembleNumber
param-doc.p: Number of models that make a prediction. The value must be lower or equal to the number of models finetuned.

param-doc.name: explainFeaturePrefix
param-doc.p: Prefix for additional features (e.g. number of votes, probability).

param-doc.name: finetunedModel
param-doc.p: Path to the directory containing the models finetuned with RE-BERT.

param-doc.name: generatedObjects
param-doc.p: Object (right) arguments of generated candidates within a scope. This expression is evaluated as a list of elements from the scope element.

param-doc.name: generatedSubjects
param-doc.p: Subject (left) arguments of generated candidates within a scope. This expression is evaluated as a list of elements from the scope element.

param-doc.name: labelFeature
param-doc.p: Feature where to store the predicted category.

param-doc.name: modelType
param-doc.p: BERT variant (bert, biobert, scibert).

param-doc.name: negativeCategory
param-doc.p: Category that is considered negative (no relation).

param-doc.name: objectRole
param-doc.p: Name of the object (right) argument in tuples created for generated candidates.

param-doc.name: python
param-doc.p: Path to the Python interpreter. If not set, then will use the Python interpreter from the PATH environment variable.

param-doc.name: rebertDir
param-doc.p: Path to RE-BERT directory.

param-doc.name: relation
param-doc.p: Name of the relation for generated candidates.

param-doc.name: relationName
param-doc.p: Deprecated alias for relation.

param-doc.name: sentenceLayer
param-doc.p: Layer containing sentences.

param-doc.name: start
param-doc.p: Start position of candidates (asserted and generated). This expression is evaluated as an integer from the candidate element.

param-doc.name: subjectRole
param-doc.p: Name of the subject (left) argument in tuples created for generated candidates.

param-doc.name: useGPU
param-doc.p: Use GPU instead of CPU.
